result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody J Allery

records.addlTxt: Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- S.K.

$1,000 signature bond with the first $200 in cash.  INCLUDES 22CM808, 22CM809, 22CM810 & 22CM811. No contact with victim(s):  SHK or HBM or their residences.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:19 pm 
INCLUDES 22CM808, 22CM809, 22CM810, & 22CM811. 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Reading Waived. Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $1000 signature bond with first $200 cash to cover all files - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): SHK or HBM or their residences. 
- Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- No possession of dangerous weapons. 
- Prints and photograph. 

COURT remands deft into custody. 

BRANCH 5 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 10/31/2022 at 9:00 am. 
JPTC: 11/14/2022 at 10:30 am. 
Jury Status Review: 12/12/2022 at 9:00 am. 
Jury Trial: 1/24/2023 at 9:00 am.
